title: Hyper Protect DBaaS for MongoDB docs
introduction: Welcome to the Hyper Protect DBaaS for MongoDB documentation, where you can find information about how to create and use Hyper Protect DBaaS for MongoDB service instances. This page also provides other related content for your reference. Hyper Protect DBaaS for MongoDB offers secure cloud database environments that have technology-enforced protection and high availability.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with IBM Cloud Hyper Protect DBaaS for MongoDB
section_recommended.description: Get started with a few steps without the need for specialized database skills.

section_recommended.title: Securing your data
section_recommended.description: Learn about how your data is protected in Hyper Protect DBaaS and how you can securely delete your data.

section_recommended.title: Scaling RAM, disk, and vCPU
section_recommended.description: You can manually adjust the amount of resources available to your service instance to suit your workload and the size of your data.

tiles.title: Changed: Automatic handling in tolerance situations
tiles.description: In the tolerance situation during creating, disabling, and restoring service instances, operations on the pending node will be completed automatically later (previously by SRE).

tiles.title: Changed: Activity Tracker and Log Analysis are available in Sydney for Hyper Protect DBaaS for MongoDB
tiles.description: If you want to integrate Activity Tracker or Log Analysis with your Hyper Protect DBaaS for MongoDB service instance in `Sydney (au-syd)`, you need to have an Activity Tracker or Log Analysis service instance also in `Sydney (au-syd)` (previously `Dallas (us-south)`).
